intro: Duckeella caquetana, commonly known as the Caquetá duckeella, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. It thrives in humid, lowland environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
